conclusion: Analyze forces on wooden block P and board ab.
Wooden block P slides on board ab; forces on P include normal force, gravitational force, and frictional force.
Frictional force f2 on block P is calculated as f2 = μ2 mg.
Forces on board ab include normal force from ground, gravitational force, frictional force from ground, and frictional force from block P.
Frictional force f2 from block P is f2 = μ2 mg.
For board ab to remain stationary, frictional force f1 from ground must balance f2.
Magnitude of frictional force exerted by ground on board ab is f1 = μ2 mg.
Final answer: Magnitude of frictional force is μ2 mg.
